title: What percentage of completed books end up getting published? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s no way to determine this. We can’t look on everybody’s hard drive or in the bottom drawer of their desk to find completed, yet unpublished manuscripts. Toss out any number you want. I do know the percentage of books published is higher since the development of easy-to-use self-publishing methods. Ebooks also upped the published percentage since the cost is nil. You want your own book published? Then do it. 100% guaranteed to be sent out to the public for purchase. That doesn’t mean anybody will buy it, of course.

If you are talking about traditionally published novels then the number is around 3%. Self-publishing obviously has much higher numbers since it is relatively easy to throw an ebook up on KDP< KOBO, Smashwords, or any of the other platforms out there.
